title: Uninstalling a specific server
body: I have both NA and EU servers and probably some others installed, but I don't want to play on them anymore. Is there any way to uninstall specifically one server? Sorry if repost, I tried searching and no results.

replies.body:
Hey Lynne,

You can't really uninstall a specific server per se, however, you can delete the region-specific files you no longer need. Within the folder, _C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects_ (if you installed League of Legends in the default location), you should be able to locate the region-specific folders and delete them.

These folders will have a (region) or (language) in its name. For instance, my folder currently contains the following:
- lol_air_client
- lol_air_client_config_euw
- lol_air_client_config_na
- lol_air_client_config_oc1
- lol_game_client
- lol_game_client_en_au
- lol_game_client_en_gb
- lol_game_client_en_us
- lol_launcher
- lol_patcher

If I decided that I was going to play on Oceania exclusively and do not need the NA and EUW files anymore, I would delete the following:
- lol_air_client_config_euw
- lol_air_client_config_na
- lol_game_client_en_gb
- lol_game_client_en_us

Keep in mind that your logs will remain region-independent, so there's no way to delete just the NA and EUW logs. As always, if you make modifications to the game directory in any way, I highly encourage you to play a few Custom Games to make sure that your game client continues to work as expected before jumping into a match made game.
